fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • An article (Private firms win £15bn of NHS contracts in five years, 30 November, page 21) cited a report stating that a contract for postal services at Guy’s and St Thomas’ trust was worth £224m. In fact, it was worth £22.4m, which in turn meant that non-NHS providers had already agreed contracts for £3.1bn of services this year, not £3.3bn. Further, the article said that the awarding of the contracts “cast[s] doubt on … repeated Conservative denials during the election campaign that the NHS is not for sale”. That should have referred to Conservative denials that the service is up for sale. Other recently corrected articles include: Cultural appropriation of Māori traditions is an exercise in entitlement and privilege
